noun.description: A bone in the wrist below the base of the thumb.

proper noun.description: The multiple star Theta Orionis, which lies within the Great Nebula of Orion and illuminates it. Four stars are visible in a small telescope and two more with a larger telescope.

origin: Late 16th century: via late Latin from Greek trapezion, from trapeza table. The term has been used in anatomy since the mid 19th century.
